newsitem.title: MEXICO: Apasco, Ahmsa formalise cement-slag plant accord.
newsitem.headline: Apasco, Ahmsa formalise cement-slag plant accord.

text.p: Mexican steel giant Altos Hornos de Mexico (Ahmsa) and cement firm Apasco SA formalised on Thursday their plans to build a $150 million cement plant that uses a key slag component from steel making, the companies said in a statement.
The previously announced move was signed on Thursday in the presence of President Ernesto Zedillo, the companies said.

Once Apasco reaches a certain level of sales versus installed capacity, it will begin building a cement plant in the northern city of Monclova, Mexico and will use slag from Ahmsa's steel complexes in the city as a raw material.
The plant will have an installed capacity of 1.3 million tonnes of cement per year.
